intro: Anthephora, commonly known as the "tree of life," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, inconspicuous flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to Africa and Madagascar. Anthephora plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often with a distinctive branching pattern. Their botanical features make them of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
